Criterion:

Problem:
Problem:

With large variation (wide confidence limits): it is very difficult to satisfy the regulatory criterion, unless the number of subjects (N) is very large

limits):
it is very difficult to satisfy the regulatory

unless the number of subjects (N) is very
large

WHICH STUDY CONDITION? STEADY-STATE STUDIES
WHICH STUDY CONDITION?
STEADY-STATE STUDIES

Comparative parameters, especially of Cmax, have often (but not always) smaller variation in steady-state studies than following single oral administration

often (but not always) smaller variation in steady-state
studies than following single oral administration
